metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0009 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: In calc_vm_may_flags of ashmem.c, there is a possible arbitrary write toshared memory due to a permissions bypass. This could lead to localescalation of privilege by corrupting memory shared between processes, withno additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not neededfor exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID:A-142938932

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
